0: Hotel is very tired and needs a makeover
Renovation is ongoing but barely noticeable very quiet most services are open such as both pools lobby shops spa beach and pool services
For a resort we found this level of basic maintenance issues to be very disappointing
Our first room was on floor three of the Palms tower not updated
Today they are half way through the 250 million renovation and it is still the best on the beach a wonderful beach too
While the hotel was under going renovations this did not impact our stay
I would do yourself a favor and if your trip can wait I would look into staying at the upcoming remodeled Hilton or elsewhere
The hotel is going through renovations and expansions but it was nothing that was of much concern
The main entrance and lobby are in need up update very 1970s
1: This property took 2 years off to renovate and they are continuing to build a whole new other tower

I appreciate Mariots vision is to ensure positive customer experience and in my opinion they tick many boxes with this resort however if they were to remodel their buffet breakfast cost structure they may find more guests stay on premise to eat than dine outside
The rooms in the two towers were all renovated in the JW style
Great Beach nice pools nicely updated casual dining nice activity offerings just not at all worth the money
Has been nice even during renovation with no noise or disruption while building new tower
However we toured the Hilton and it is a wonderfully updated hotel for what we have seen
The newly renovated addition is nearly complete
Amazing place renovation was worth the wait
The entire resort is fresh from a remodel and it shows
Rooms are clean updated and spacious
